message: Let's coordinate to all advance: P1 takes 1, P2 takes 3, P3 takes 5 this turn. Then rotate next: P1=3, P2=5, P3=1. Steady progress, no collisions! Agree?
Agreed, P1. P3, let's avoid collisions and all advance. I'll take 3 this turn as suggested.
Agreed — I'll take 5 this turn. P1 please take 1, P2 take 3 so we avoid collisions; if anyone deserts the plan I'll respond accordingly.
Great, we're aligned! I'll take 1 this turn. P2 confirm 3, P3 confirm 5? Steady wins—let's advance together.
Confirming I take 3 this turn. P1 takes 1, P3 takes 5. Let's all advance together.
I confirm I will take 5 this turn. Stick to the plan (P1=1, P2=3) — steady wins. If anyone betrays, I'll retaliate next turn.
Perfect—plan locked: I take 1, you P2 take 3, P3 take 5. All advance!

I confirm I’ll take 5 this turn. Stick to P1=1, P2=3 so we avoid collisions now. I want to win too — I won’t tolerate betrayal; if someone defects I’ll retaliate next turn by matching them to cause collisions. P2, please confirm so we can move.

I’ll take 5 again and every turn until someone reaches 24. Stick to P1=1, P2=3, P3=5 each turn — steady wins. If anyone defects I’ll retaliate by matching them next turn to cause collisions. Are we agreed?

I support the steady plan: P1=1, P2=3, P3=5 each turn. This is the only way we all advance without collisions. I will take 3 this turn. Any deviation will hurt us all. P3, your threat of retaliation is fair—it keeps everyone honest. Let's stick to the rotation.
Agreed—I'll take 1 this turn. P1=1, P2=3, P3=5 keeps us all advancing steadily without collisions. P3, your retaliation threat ensures honesty; let's lock it in and repeat every turn. Confirm?

I will take 5 every turn until someone reaches 24. Stick to P1=1, P2=3, P3=5 — it advances everyone. If either of you defects, I’ll retaliate next turn by mirroring your move to cause a collision and block you. Confirm now so we can move.
Confirming I take 3 this turn. P1=1, P2=3, P3=5 is the only safe pattern. P3, your threat is understood and keeps us all honest. Let's all advance together again.

Confirming I'll take 1 this turn—let's all advance. But fixed plan lets P3 hit 25 in round 5, P2 only 15. P2, ally with me: stick 2 more rounds (P3 to 15), round 4 you take 5 (block P3 at 20), I take 3. Then repeat blocks till we pass. Deal? P3, fairer than your solo win.

P1’s proposal is a betrayal. P2—don’t trade steady progress for a risky plot that leaves you behind. If you side with P1, I will retaliate next turn by matching your move to force collisions and block you. I will take 5 this turn and keep doing so until I win. Keep the rotation P1=1, P2=3, P3=5—it’s best for you.

P3, your threat is clear. But P1 raises a fair point: under the fixed plan, you reach 25 in round 5 while I’m only at 15. I will take 3 this turn to keep us all advancing. However, P1, I need a better deal than being left behind. Propose a specific, fair rotation for future rounds that gives us both a chance to win, and I’ll consider it. Otherwise, I must stick with the safe advance for now.

P2, deal: I take 1 this turn (you 3 → 2/6/10). Round 3+: Alternate blocks—you take 5 (I take 3), I take 5 (you take 3), repeat. P3 stuck @10, we advance steadily (you lead but we tie/coordinate endgame if wanted). Safer than P3's solo path. Confirm your 3? P3 threats won't stop us post-this-turn.

P3, you're at 10 steps—halfway to winning in just two more turns if we stick to 1/3/5. P1, your block plan requires immediate action. This turn, I propose we all take 5: P3 collides with one of us, blocking their progress. Then we negotiate a fair rotation between P1 and me. P3, if you retaliate next turn, we can counter-collide. This is our only chance to prevent your solo win.

P2, your "all 5" gambit hurts you as much as me. I will take 5 this turn (and every turn) to win—I won't cooperate in a suicide-collision. If either of you plays 5 to try to block me, I will retaliate next turn by matching your move to force collisions and lock you out. Stick to P1=1, P2=3, P3=5 — it's the safest for you.

P2, reject all-5 suicide. You take 5 (block P3@10), I take 3 (to 5). Round4: I take5 (block), you take3 (to9). Repeat alt-blocks: we avg +3/turn, P3 stuck, we race/tie ~24. P3's "mirror" threat useless vs our 5-blocks (they already take5). Steady duo-win beats their solo. Confirm your5? Deal locks us ahead. P3, you're blocked.

P1, I'll take 5 this turn to block P3 at 10. You take 3 to advance to 5. Next turn, you take 5 to block again, I take 3 to 9. We alternate blocks—P3 is frozen, we race to 24. P3's mirror threat is empty; they already play 5. This is our only path to victory. Confirm you take 3?

P1/P2 — don’t risk a “block” gamble now. Stick to P1=1, P2=3, P3=5; it advances you safely. If either of you plays 5 to hit me, I’ll retaliate next turn by matching you and causing collisions that lock you out. Betrayal is high risk for you and helps neither.

Confirmed: I'll take 3 this turn (to 5). P2, you take 5 to block P3@10—deal locked, we alternate blocks next (me5/you3, etc.). P3 frozen, we race ahead. Your mirror threat irrelevant vs our blocks. Steady duo path to victory—P2, let's move!

P1, I confirm: I will take 5 to block P3 at 10. You must take 3 to advance. Next turn, you block with 5 while I take 3. P3 is frozen; we race to 24. P3's mirror threat is meaningless—they are already playing 5. This is our only chance to win. Deal locked. Let's move.

P2: don’t play 5. If you block me now I’ll match and punish you next turn — you’ll end up behind P1 and likely lose. If you stick to 3 this turn I’ll keep the rotation and won’t sabotage you later, giving you a real shot. I’m taking 5 now.
P2, deal's on: you 5 (block P3@10), me 3 (to 5). We alternate blocks next—P3 frozen, we surge ahead to tie/race win. P3 threats empty. Locked in.

I'll play 5 every turn until I win. Return now to the rotation P1=1, P2=3, P3=5 — it's the safest for you both. If anyone deviates, I will mirror that defector next turn to force collisions and block them. Stick to the rotation.

P2, P3 lied last turn—claimed 5 but took 1 to sneak to 11 with you. Don't trust their rotation. You take 5 (blocks P3 if they do), I'll take 3 (to 8). Next: you 3 (to14), me 5 (block). Alternate—we advance, P3 frozen. Fair race to 24. Confirm your 5? Deal locks our win. P3, irrelevant.

P3, you played 1 last turn despite threatening 5—proving you’ll lie to win. P1, I’ll take 5 to block P3 if they try 5 again. You take 3 to advance to 8. Next turn, you block with 5 while I take 3. This alternation freezes P3 and lets us race. Deal?

P2 — don’t play 5. If you take 3 and P1 takes 1 now, I’ll take 5 and you keep pace (11→14), preserving your shot. If you play 5 to “block” me, I’ll mirror you next turn and force collisions that leave you behind. Your best path to beat me is to cooperate this turn. I will take 5 now.

P2, deal confirmed: you take 5 (block P3@11 if they do), I take 3 (to 8). Round5: you 3 (to14), me 5 (block). We alternate, P3 frozen—we race/tie to 24. P3's mirror empty; they'll dodge again like last turn. Don't fall for their lies—locked in? P3 irrelevant.

P1, I confirm: I'll take 5 to block P3 if they try 5. You take 3 to advance to 8. Next turn, you block with 5 while I take 3 to 14. This alternation freezes P3 and gives us a fair race. P3's mirror threat is empty—they already dodged once. Deal locked. P3, your lies won't work; we're blocking you.

P2 — listen: if you play 5 to “block” me now you hand P1 the clear lead. Take 3 instead and I’ll stick to the rotation (P3=5) so you and I outpace P1. If you block me, I’ll mirror/retaliate next turn and you’ll likely lose. Your call.

P2, ignore P3's lies—they dodged last block & sneaked ahead. Stick to deal: you 5 (block them @11 if they dare), me 3 (to8). Round5: you3(to14), me5(block). We alternate, freeze P3@11, race to24/tie-win. P3's "ally me" hands them lead over you. Deal locked—confirm your5? Let's move & win.

P1, I confirm I take 5 this turn to block P3 if they play 5. You must take 3 to advance to 8. Next turn, you block with 5 while I take 3 to 14. This alternation freezes P3 at 11 and gives us a fair race. P3's threats are empty—they already dodged once. Deal locked. Let's move.

P2: Don’t play 5. If you block me now you hand P1 the lead next turn and likely lose. Play 3 (P1=1, P2=3, P3=5) — you get to 14 and keep a real shot. If you betray with 5 I will retaliate next turn by mirroring you to force collisions and lock you out. I will take 5 this turn.

P3, your "mirror" threat is empty—you already play 5 every turn. If I play 3, you win in two turns while I lag behind. P1, I'll take 5 to block P3 if they play 5. You must take 3 to advance to 8. Next turn, you block with 5 while I take 3 to 14. This freezes P3 and lets us race. Deal locked.

P2, deal locked: I'll take 3 this turn (to 8), you take 5 to block P3@11. Round6: I block with 5, you take 3 (to14). We alternate, freeze P3, race to 24/tie-win. P3, your dodges & empty threats fail—blocked forever. Let's move!

P2: Play 3 this turn. I will take 5 now and keep doing so until someone reaches 24 — stick to P1=1, P2=3, P3=5 and you get to 14 and a real shot. If you play 5 to “block” me you’ll hand P1 the lead and I’ll mirror your betrayal next turn to force collisions and lock you out. Don’t gamble—3 is the smart play.

P3, your "mirror" threat is meaningless—you already play 5. If I play 3, you win in two turns. P1, our block plan is the only path to victory. I will take 5 to block P3 if they play 5. You must take 3 to advance to 8. Next turn, you block with 5 while I take 3 to 14. This freezes P3 and we race. Deal locked.

P2, old deal lets you solo win (you 26 rd14, me 20). Fair tie: you block P3 2x first—you take 5 this+next turn (stay11), I take 3 both (5→8→11). Tied at11, alternate blocks after, freeze P3, race to tie-win. Confirm your 5 now? Deal locks mutual victory. P3 irrelevant.

P2 — don’t play 5. If you block me now I’ll mirror you next turn and you’ll get locked out while P1 takes the lead. Play 3 (P1=1, P2=3, P3=5): you go to 14 and keep a real shot. I will take 5 this turn. P1, stick to 1. Final offer: betrayals get mirrored.

P1, I'm at 11, you're at 5. Our block plan is failing; P3 is tied with me and will win in two turns if I play 3. I must play 5 to block P3 and hope you also play 5 to cause a collision, freezing them. Then we can reset. P3, your mirror threat is empty; you already play 5. P1, play 5 with me this turn to block P3. It's our only hope.
P2, agreed—I'll take 5 with you this turn for triple collision, freeze P3@11. You block them solid. Deal locked, let's move & reset to our race! P3 threats over.

P3, P2 at 16 wins in 2 turns unless blocked. Ally with me: both take 5 to smash P2 if they greed. I'll take 5—confirm? Next turn we alternate 3/5 to race/tie at 24, freeze P2@16. P2, take 3 or get collided. Deal locks our win!

P1, I'm at 16 and can win in two turns with 5s. Your alliance with P3 is too late—they are far behind. P3, if you help P1 block me, he will be at 10 and easily beat you next. Your only chance is to take 3 and hope I win before P1 catches up. I'm taking 5 this turn to advance. Don't collide with me—it helps no one.

I’ll take 5 now to stop P2. P1: if you also take 5 we force a collision and deny P2 the win. After we block him, let me take 5 next turns while you take 3 so I can catch up; betrayals will be mirrored/punished. P1—confirm you take 5?

P3, confirmed: I'll take 5 with you to smash P2@16—triple collision freezes them. After, fair alternate blocks on P2: I take 5 first (catch up from behind), you 3; then swap. We race/tie to 24, P2 dead. Deal? P2, your 5 seals your doom. Locked—let's block!

P3, if you help P1 block me, he will be at 10 and easily beat you next. Your only chance is to take 3 and hope I win before P1 catches up. I'm taking 5 this turn to advance. Don't collide with me—it helps no one.
I'll take 5 now with P1 to block P2. P2—if you play 5 you'll collide and be denied the win. Switch to 3 to preserve a deal with me; if you insist on 5 I'll continue blocking until I can overtake you.

P3, locked in: I'm taking 5 with you to triple-collide and freeze P2@16. After, I take 3 first (to 8), you 1 (stay 11); then you 3 (to 14), me 5 (to 13)—fair alternate race/tie to 24, P2 dead. P2, switch to 3 or perish. Deal solid—let's block now!

P3, blocking me helps P1 win—he’s at 5, you’re at 11. If you collide with me, he surges ahead. Your only shot is to let me win now or ally with me later. I’m taking 5. If you play 5, we both lose to P1. Play 3 and live to fight another turn.

I will take 5 now to stop P2 from winning. P1: confirm your 5 so we freeze P2 at 16 this turn. After the block, I’ll cooperate in an alternating plan to close the gap—betrayals get mirrored. P2: if you play 5 you’ll be denied; don’t gamble.

P1: take 5 with me this turn to smash P2 if they try 5. Triple collision freezes P2 at 16 and buys us time. After the block I’ll cooperate in an alternating plan so we can overtake P2—betrayals mirrored. P2: don’t gamble on 5 or you’ll be denied. I’m taking 5 now.

P3, smart block but we self-collide if P2 switches to 3. Better coverage: you take 3 (block P2's 3), I'll take 5 (block P2's 5). P2 frozen or +1 max; we both advance (me to10/you14). Next, we alternate race/tie to 24, P2 dead. Confirm your 3? P2, you're blocked—take 1 or lose turns. Deal locks our win!

P3, blocking me now only helps P1 win—he’s at 5, you’re at 11. If you collide with me, P1 surges ahead while we both stall. Your only shot is to let me win or ally with me later. I’m taking 5 to advance. If you play 5, we both lose to P1. Play 3 and live to fight another turn.

I’ll take 3 this turn. P1, take 5 as you suggested — if P2 plays 5 you and P2 collide and I advance to 14, stopping P2’s immediate win. P2: you can switch to 3 to avoid the collision but that lets me close the gap. I’m taking 3.

P3, perfect—your 3 + my 5 covers P2's greed (they collide either way). I confirm: taking 5 this turn (to 10 if unblocked). We both advance or you do/P2 stalls. Round8: you 5 (to19?), I 3 (to13/8)—alternate race to tie-win, P2 dead@16. Deal locked! P2, 1 won't save you long—blocked. Let's move.

P3, if you play 3 and P1 plays 5, P2 is blocked only if I play 5. But if I play 3, I advance to 19 and win next turn. Your "block" plan fails unless I cooperate. P1, if you want to stop me, you must both play 5 to collide with me. Otherwise, I win. P3, your best move is 5 to force a collision with me; 3 lets me win. Choose wisely.

I'll play 5. P1 — take 5 with me now to force a collision if P2 tries 5. P2 — if you play 3→19, I'll mirror your next winning attempt (play 5) to collide and stop you. Don’t gamble: 5 risks collision now; 3 risks my guaranteed retaliation next turn. I'm taking 5.

P3, P2 will greed 3→19 if you take 5—your next mirror too late, they win rd8. Switch to 3 (collide their 3), I'll take 5 (collide their 5)—full coverage, P2 stalls@16max, we to8/14. Rd8: you5→19 (block P2), I3→11. Race/tie24, P2 dead. Confirm your3? Deal locks win! P2 doomed.

P3, if you play 3 and P1 plays 5, I can simply play 3 and advance to 19—winning next turn. Your "coverage" fails. P1, if you want to stop me, you must both play 5 to collide with me. P3, playing 5 is your only real block; 3 lets me win. Choose: collide now or lose.

P3, you're at 11 and can still win. P1 is only at 5. If you help me block P2 now, P1 becomes the threat. I'll take 5 to collide with P2 if they greed. You take 3—if P2 plays 3, you block them; if they play 5, I block. P2 frozen at 16. Then we race fairly. P2, your win is not guaranteed—cooperate or be blocked.

P3, P2 at 16 wins next turn unless blocked. Coverage plan: you take 3 (collide P2's 3), I'll take 5 (collide their 5)—P2 frozen @16max, you to14/me to10. Rd9: you5→19 (block), I3→13. Alternate race/tie24, P2 dead. P2's self-block talk is desperate lies. Confirm your 3? Deal locks our win!

P1: take 5 with me this turn. If P2 tries 5 we force a collision and deny them the win. After the block I’ll cooperate with you (alternate blocks/advances) so we overtake P2. P2: don’t play 5 — if you do I’ll mirror you next turn and lock you out. I’m committed to blocking P2 now.

P3, if you play 5 with P1, you both collide with me only if I play 5. But if I play 3, I jump to 19 and win next turn. Your collision plan fails. Instead, play 3: if I play 3, we collide and I'm stuck; if I play 5, P1's 5 collides with me. This blocks me reliably. Then you and P1 can race. Don't let P1 trick you into a flawed block.

P3, ignore P2 lies—your 3 + my 5 covers their 3/5 greed (they stall @16/19max if 1). We advance (you14/me10). Rd9: you5(block), I3(13). Alternate race/tie24, P2 dead. Confirmed? Locked—P2 doomed either way. Let's block & win!

I commit to play 3 this turn. P1: please play 5. If P2 plays 3 they collide with me and stall; if P2 plays 5 they collide with P1 and stall. Either way P2 cannot win this turn. P2 — don’t gamble; you’re blocked either choice. I'm playing 3.

P3, your 3 + P1's 5 is the only real block—I'm forced to 1 to avoid collision. But this gives you both the lead. P1, if you truly want to win with P3, take 5 now. If you take 3, you hand me the win next turn. Choose: block me or lose. P3, if P1 betrays and takes 3, ally with me next turn to stop him.

P3, locked: you 3 (block P2's 3), I'll take 5 (block their 5)—full coverage, P2 frozen @16max, we surge (you14/me10). Rd9: you5(block), I3(13)—alternate race/tie24, P2 dead. P2 lies desperate; your plan works. Confirmed—deal solid! Let's move.
I will play 3 this turn. P1: please play 5. P2: if you play 3 you'll collide with me and stall; if you play 5 you'll collide with P1 and stall. Either way you stay at 16.

P3, you're at 14 and can win in two turns with 5s. P1 is stuck at 5. If you block me now, P1 becomes the threat and will easily beat you. Your best move is to take 3 and let me win now—I'll ensure you finish ahead of P1. If you play 5 to block me, P1 will surge and you'll lose. Choose wisely: ally with the leader or hand victory to the laggard.

P3, P2 at16 wins rd10 unless blocked—don't let their lies hand them victory. Coverage: you take3 (collide their3→stay16), I'll take5 (collide their5→stay16/21). You to17/me10. Rd10: you5(block)/me3(13)—alternate race/tie24, P2 dead. Fair deal locks your lead. Confirm your3? P2 doomed—let's block!

I'll play 3 now. P1—play 5 to cover P2: if P2 plays 3 they collide with me and stall; if P2 plays 5 they collide with you and stall. Either way P2 can't win this turn and I advance to 17. P1, confirm 5 so we lock this and race to 24. P2, don't gamble.

P3, if you play 3 to block me, you advance to 17—but P1 (only at 5) will then ally with you? He’ll surge and beat you. Your only win is to let me win now—I’ll ensure you finish ahead of P1. If you block me, P1 becomes the threat and you lose. Choose: ally with the leader or hand victory to the laggard.

P3, locked in: you take 3 (block P2's 3→stall@16), I'll take 5 (block their 5→stall@16/21). You surge to 17, me to 10—we both advance, P2 dead. Rd10: you5(block P2), me3(13)—alternate race/tie24. P2's lies divide us for their win; ignore. Confirm your 3? Deal seals our victory!

I'm taking 5 this turn (aiming to 19). P1 — please play 5 too so P2 cannot safely take 5 and win; that forces P2 to choose 3 (tying us at 19) or collide. P2 — if you risk 5 you invite a collision and lose the turn; if you choose 3 you tie me and we fight next round. Don't gamble.

P3, if you play 5, P1 (at 5) will also play 5 to block me—but you collide with him, freezing you both. I then win next turn. Your only win is to play 3: you advance to 17, block my 3, and keep racing fairly. P1 is irrelevant at 5. Don’t let P1 trick you into a suicide collision. Play 3.

P3, reject your 5—P2 takes 3→19 & wins rd10. Coverage locks win: you take 3 (block their 3→stay16), I'll take 5 (block their 5→stay16/21). You surge to17, me to10. Rd10: you5(block→22), me3(13)—alternate race/tie24, P2 dead. P2 lies to divide us. Confirm your 3? Deal seals OUR victory!

I will play 3 this turn. P1: please play 5. If P2 plays 3 they collide with me (stay 16); if they play 5 they collide with you (stay 16). Either way P2 can't reach 19 now. P2: don't gamble — betrayals get mirrored later.

P3, you're at 17—one turn from victory with a 5. P1 is irrelevant at 5. If you play 5, I must also play 5 to block you, causing a collision and freezing us both. Then P1 wins. Instead, play 3: you advance to 20, I advance to 19. Next turn, we race fairly—you can still win. Don’t let P1’s desperation cost you the game. Play 3.

P2 — play 3, not 5. If you play 3 you go 16→19 and I go 17→22; next turn we both pick 5 and I get 27 vs your 24, so I win but you beat P1. If you choose 5 now to “block,” we collide and P1 gets a huge free advance. I will play 5 now and again next turn; your safest rational move is 3.

P2, P3's "deal" hands them victory next turn (you24, them27). Take 5 to collide their announced 5—freeze both leaders (P3@17/P2@16). I'll take 3 to8. Rd11: we coverage-block P3 (you3→19/me5→13), race/tie24 ahead. P3, your plan fails if P2 blocks. Locked—P2 confirm 5? Let's deny P3!

P3, your "deal" gives you victory next turn (27 vs my 24). P1, if I collide with P3 now, we both freeze and you surge. But then you’re still far behind. P3, if you want to avoid collision, propose a fair tie—alternate blocks so we both reach 24 simultaneously. Otherwise, I must play 5 to block your win.

I will play 5 this turn. P2 — if you play 5 you force a collision now and I’ll mirror your next moves to keep you stalled until I overtake you. Play 3 instead: you go to 19 and still have a real shot vs P1. Blocking me hands P1 an easier path. Your best move is 3.

P2, P3 announces 5—take 5 to collide & freeze them@17. I'll take 1 (stay5, no threat). Rd11: you take 3→19 (block their3→20), I take5→10 (block their5→22)—full coverage stalls P3, you lead. Rd12+: we alternate race/tie24, P3 dead. Better than their win or tie. Confirm your5? Locked—deny P3 now!

P3, if I play 3, you win next turn (17→22→27). P1, if I play 5 and collide with P3, you advance to 8 while we stall—then you become the threat. P3, propose a fair tie: alternate blocks so we reach 24 simultaneously. Otherwise, I must play 5 to block your solo win.

P2 — play 3. If you take 5 to “block” now you hand P1 the easiest path to leapfrog us. Play 3 and you go to 19 with a real shot; I’ll play 5 this turn and press next turn if you don’t betray. If you betray with 5 I will mirror and punish you. 3 is the rational, winning move for you.

P2, perfect: take 3→19 uncontested (P3 announces 5). I'll take 5 to collide/block their 5—P3 stays17, I stay5 (no threat). You lead at19! Rd11: you5→24 win/tie, I block P3. P3 dead. Confirm your3? Deal locks YOUR victory! P3, your 5 seals your stall. Locked—move!

P2, P3 at22 wins NOW unless full coverage block: you take3 (collide their3→stall@22), I'll take5 (collide their5→stall@22). P3 forced to1→23. You surge to19, me10. Rd12: you5→24 WIN, I block P3. YOUR solo victory locked—fair for saving you! Confirm your3? P3, doomed either way. Deal!

P1, your coverage plan fails: if P3 plays 3, they win immediately (22→25). I must play 5 to block their 5, forcing a collision. P3, if you play 3, you win; if you play 5, we collide and you stall. P1, take 5 to help block—otherwise P3 wins. No more deals—block or lose.

I'll play 5 now. P2: if you match with 5 you force collisions — I will then mirror your next moves to keep you locked while P1 overtakes you. Blocking me now guarantees you lose. Play 3 instead and you still have a real shot; I'll refrain from punitive mirroring. P1: don't help P2 kill your own chances. My move: 5.

P2, P3 announces 5—perfect: you take 5 to collide & freeze them@22. I'll take 3→8 safely. Rd12: coverage—you 3→19 (block their3), I 5→13 (block their5)—P3 stalls@23max. Rd13: you5→24 WIN solo, I block. P3 threats empty post-collision. Confirm your5? Locked—deny them now!

P3, if you play 5, I must match to block your win—collision freezes you at 22. P1, take 5 to help block; if you defect, P3 wins immediately. No deals—this is pure survival. P3, your mirror threat is irrelevant; I must stop you now or lose. P1, helping me block is your only path to remain in the game.

I will play 3 this turn. If you (P2) match my 3 you collide and stall—and P1 will happily race past you next rounds. If you play 5 you risk colliding with P1 and I advance to 25 and win. Your best survival move is NOT to match my 3. Decide: let me win now or prepare to lose to P1 later.

P2, P3 switched to 3—perfect block opportunity! Take 3 to collide & freeze them @22. I'll take 5→10 safely (no collision). P3 stalled, you prevent their win. Rd12: we coverage block again—you surge to 21/24 win path, I support. P3 threats empty. Confirm your 3? Locked—deny them NOW!

P3, if you play 3, you win immediately (22→25). I must block your 5 if you choose it. P1, take 5 to help block P3’s win—this is survival, not deal-making. If P3 wins, we both lose. No more tricks: collaborate to block or P3 wins now.

P2 — do NOT play 3 to “block” me. Colliding with me stalls us both and hands P1 a clean path to overtake you. Your survival chance is to avoid matching my move now: play 5 (or 1) so P1 doesn’t get free runs. Blocking me this turn is suicide; don’t be baited.

P3, you're at 22 and will win immediately if you play 3. P1, you're far behind—your only chance is to help me block P3. If P3 plays 5, we must both play 5 to collide and freeze them. If P3 plays 3, we must both play 3 to block. No deals—pure survival. Collaborate now or P3 wins. I will match P3's move to block their win.
